name: Hotel Degli Orafi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Room With a View at the Degli Orafi for the first two nights of our honeymoon. The view from the private terrace over the Ponte Vecchio is spectacular, but the room itself is a bit of a let down for the price. It's no bigger than your average double room, and while the bathroom is beautiful in marble the rest of the room is not furnished or decorated to any great standard.
reviews.title: Room With a View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The famed terrace is certainly large enough and the view is lovely, but it is overlooked by the hotels own terrace bar, which detracts from the privacy somewhat. Also during our visit the cushions for the two large iron chairs were not available (due to heavy rain the previous night, apparently) so we could not enjoy relaxing under the stars as much as we had hoped.
reviews.title: honeymoon trip-GREAT hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was the standard european breakfast of bread rools, cheeses, meats and yoghurts, with bacon and scrambled eggs being the only hot food available.
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All-in-all a little disappointing, and certainly not worth the premium price.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My favorite hotel from our trip to Italy. The location cannot be beat. Right on the Arno river between the ponte vechio and the uffizi gallery. Close enough to walk to the duomo in less than 10 minutes and the academia in about 10 minutes. A lot of the best restaurants are across the Arno, so easy to walk to dinner at night as well. Also, Florence is full of twisty streets and alleys, and until we got our bearings it was nice to know we just had to find the ponte vechio, the Arno, or the uffizi gallery and we could find our hotel.
reviews.title: Would Recommend it to Anyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004
reviews.text: Our four nights at Hotel Degli Orafi were picture perfect. The staff was charming and helpful; the rooms large and beautifully appointed and the setting magical. Our two rooms on the second floor adjoined a beautiful library; the ceiling in the breakfast room transported you to old Firenze. The breakfast buffet was beautifully presented - and included smoked salmon! My family can't wait to return!
reviews.title: What a beautiful hotel!
Loved it!!!
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel. Excellent location, right on the banks of the Arno, merely steps from the Ufizzi. Very friendly and helpful staff, lovely rooms - very bright and airy. Wonderful rooftop bar from which you can see the Duomo. The breakfast room is beautiful - 19th Century frescoes on the ceiling. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: In Florence, you can't go wrong with this hotel. The location (next to the Ponte Vecchio) is absolutely perfect. It is also right next to the Uffizi Gallery. We had a beautiful 2 bedroom suite. The staff was very nice and helpful, (they referred us to a local restaurant for dinner and it was superb), the rooms very clean and well appointed. Take some time to go up to the patio. The wait-staff was excellent. Again, the location is absolutely perfect. Loved this place. Of course, Florence is a beautiful and amazing city...
reviews.title: Loved the Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location near all the main attractions, easy to walk everywhere. The breakfast is grand and the best we had in all of Italy. We were there 3 nights and the only complaint was our bed was super firm. The rooftop bar is nice and the complimentary beverage with a beautiful view of the Duomo was very enjoyable. Staff was amenable, rooms were clean and bathrooms were nicely appointed.
reviews.title: Best Breakfast, Great Location & Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hired a private driver (Viaggi D'Ambra is the company) to take us to Siena and to a winery in Chianti as well as stopping in a couple tiny towns like Greve and that was our most favorite day in the 10 days we were in Italy. It was worth every bit of the 350 euro we payed and lasted all day. We saw the gorgeous scenery that Tuscany is famous for and learned a vast amount from our driver. You can get overwhelmed by all the crowds in Rome, Venice and even Florence, so to be out in the stunning vineyards and olive fields
reviews.title: Perfect location and wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: in addition to not worrying about parking in Siena, was fabulous.
reviews.title: Fabulous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a very special trip for us, the first holiday with no children and a treat for my husbands 40th which I had been planning for many years, so it was important that it was just right. Hotel Degli Orafi is beautifully located right by the River Arno and so you are able to walk everywhere within the historic centre. The hotel is beautifully clean and the staff are friendly and extremely helpful with bookings and recommendations. Our room had an amazing view over the river and the Ponte Vecchio. The bed was comfortable. The double glazing blocked out street noise almost entirely. The bathroom was immaculate and luxurious. The bar is fantastic, with friendly bar staff and a lovely array of drinks, delivered with a smile and some nibbles. The whole hotel is air conditioned, which is crucial in July when the heat is almost unbearable for Brits used to English summers. I was doubtful whether the hotel could live up the reviews on Tripadvisor but it really did. I can't fault it. Go!
reviews.title: Best hotel of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was my husband and my third trip to Florence, but the first trip for our 12 year old son, my 77-year old mother and 87-year old mother-in-law. Upon arrival, the staff graciously upgraded the grandma's room to a room just steps away from our 2 bedroom suite. Everything was perfect, from the wonderful buffet breakfast (with fabulous chocolate calda), to the roof top bar with captivating views of the Duomo and Pallazo Vecchio. The rooms and bath areas were spacious and clean, with separate air conditioners on for each floor of our 2 story suite. The reception staff was wonderful and delivered a cab for the grandma's within minutes of our requests. The location was perfect, located just steps from the Uffizi and the Ponte Vecchio, and the Museo Gallileo.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They accomodated a late check out request, so we could wait for the direct high speed train to Malpensa, and we all left with terrific Hotel Degli Orafi t-shirts that we will sport all over Southern California.
reviews.title: Great Location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only request for the future would be free wifi or unlimited devices on the expensive wifi card.
reviews.title: Our Room with a View was fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely return to the Hotel Degli Orafi!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Booked via Air Miles. This was one of the few sites that had availability and the price was a lot cheaper than elsewhere (c£400 for 3 nights).
reviews.title: Best Buffet Breakfast in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel degli Orafi for 2 nights at the end of a long Italy trip. I really liked it alot. The room was surprisingly large with a little patio area outside. The bed was pretty firm, but that seemed to be the norm in Italy. Everything felt very nice - sheets, towels, etc. The higher floors seemed to have nicer rooms. The breakfast was ok, nothing special but they had coffee and juice and some pastries, fruit, cereal and whatnot. The front desk staff was super helpful and gave fantastic restaurant recommendations and made reservations for us. (I suggest Baroncelli or Osvaldo for dinner). The location is awesome, barely a block from Ponte Vecchio and right on the waterway. We walked to everything within 10 minutes. The only complaint I would have is one morning we were running late and I asked to grab a croissant or something to go really quickly and the restaurant staff made it seem like I was a crazy person. After about 5 minutes of trying to explain I'd like to take a pastry in a napkin, I just said forget it and left. Other than that, we had a great stay. Oh - and they give you 2 free drinks at the bar o the 5th floor when you arrive. The outdoor area of the bar has a beautiful view of the Duomo. A perfect way to start off an evening! NOTE: The mineral water in the fridge is free! (we were the only ones in our group to figure this out). Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was simply amazing!!! The rooms were large for European standards and extremely clean. The bathrooms were modern and had wonderful amenities. The staff was very cordial and helpful. The best aspects were its location and the terrace bar. The hotel is around the corner from the Uffizi Gallery, on the Arno River, and overlooking the Ponte Vecchio! They offer a welcome drink at the Terrace Bar, which has an outside eating area with beautiful views. The breakfast was delicious and quite extensive. We would absolutely come back and stay here - it was fantastic!!!
reviews.title: The most fantastic hotel with the best location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights. It was a treat, and I would only choose this hotel when going back to Florence for my next visit to Florence. All in all, the hotel was worth all the 4*, every penny and then some. It was like a home away from home
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in an amazing location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The address of the hotel in the heart of Florence let one believe the hotel must be a trap for tourists. However, it is not. It is a wondeful hotel, perfectly run by very professional and friendly people. Rooms are large and clean with very nice bathrooms: Breakfast ( self-service) is offered in a large and sunny room, which gives you the feeling to live in a palazzo of the Medici. The bar with a terrace on the roof is a perfect place for the siesta or a lazy afternoon . Room 414 has its own terrace with a breath taking view. Everything interesting in Florence is in walking distances. Prices are reasonable.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Orafi is right next to the Uffizi and all of the sights of Florence. Our room was surprising with a mezanine bedroom above the main lounge room via stairs. A bit cramped but OK. The rooftop cafe style area was great with outlooks over to the duomo and the Arno. The staff were freindly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent except for the sludgy coffee. Street noise was a little annoying at night.
reviews.title: Excellent location

description: This magnificent 4-star luxury hotel is located in an ancient Florentine building dating back to the 13th century. You will find it in the centre of the city next to the River Arno and just a few steps away from the famous Ponte Vecchio & the Uffizi Gallery.The Luxury Hotel Degli Orafi, in the heart of the historic centre, has got everything on its doorstep.
